## Development or Adaptation of an Analytical Method for 1,4-Benzenediamine, N,N’-mixed phenyl and tolyl derivatives

### Government of Canada Notice Solicitation Announcement

**Solicitation Notice Number**: cb-6900-54407978
**Solicitation Date:** 2023-07-04
**Tender Closing Date:** 2023-09-11 T 14:00:00
**Contract Award Period:** 2023-09-29 - 2025-03-31

### Procurement Overview

Environment and Climate Change Canada (ECCC) is seeking proposals from qualified contractors to develop an analytical method for detecting and measuring the concentration of 1,4-Benzenediamine, N,N’-mixed phenyl and tolyl derivatives (BENPAT) in industrial effluents.

### Contract Requirements

* The successful contractor will develop an analytical method that meets or exceeds the requirements outlined in the statement of work, annex A to the solicitation documents
* The developed method must be capable of detecting and measuring the concentration of the three representative components of BENPAT

### Proposal Evaluation Criteria

Proposals will be evaluated based on the following criteria:

* Technical Merit (70%)
* Price (30%)

### Contract Award Conditions

The contract will be awarded to the contractor with the highest combined rating for technical merit and price.

### Participation and Contact Information

All interested contractors are required to submit their proposals in response to the solicitation notice. For more information, prospective contractors may contact Annie Emard, Environment and Climate Change Canada,  to request additional information.

* Email: annie.emard@ec.gc.ca
* Phone: (819) 200-7216

### Relevant Documents

The solicitation notice and additional documents related to this tender can be downloaded from the [Canadabuys website](https://canadabuys.canada.ca/).
